attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     +08loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was +257 pieces

All other materials had either zero or negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·           The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances. and maintain strong internal controls.
attributes.effect: + Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: ·           Strong internal controls will be maintained.
Control is ok and will maintain the trend
May 2025 audit report highlighted that physical stock verified on 16.05.2025 showed surplus stocks of polybags (+1,194pcs), utto (+7.243ltrs) and yeast shortfall stocks of 7*125g.
Previous

·           A stock take exercise was conducted on 16.06.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal item variation was noted hence strong internal controls.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls for available inventory.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis.
attributes.description:
1)      Dough weights:

·          The below table shows analysis of dough weights sampled on 16/06/2025;

Dough weights sampled on 16.06.2025:(2 shift @9.35am)

ü  Dough weights showed high overweight rate.
attributes.recommendation: ·         Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.
attributes.effect: + Inconsistent dough dividing weights would result to bread weight extremes which have a negative impact to the company.

value: ·         We will enhance spot checks to ensure dough dividing adheres to set standard weights to check extreme bread weights.
+ We will continue emphasizing on strict adherence to set dough dividing weights to ensure production of standard weight bread.
+ Packed bread weighed on 16.05.25 showed high underweight bread samples.
Previous
·         Sample varieties of dough were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Inconsistent dough weights were noted meaning set standard dough dividing weights were not adhered to. This show noncompliance to set policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set standard dough dividing weights are adhered to.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis
attributes.description: ·         Bread weights were sampled on 16/06/2025 and the following below were the results.
attributes.recommendation:
·         Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

Alarming high underweight bread should be addressed.
attributes.effect:
·         Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing as justified by dough weights sampled.

·         Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence withholding revenue targets.

Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

value: ·         We will enhance spot checks to ensure dough dividing adheres to set standard weights to check extreme bread weights.
More controls on weight will be put to address the observed overweight loaves.
Packed bread weighed on 16.05.25 showed high underweight bread samples.
Previous
Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Both under and overweight loaves were noted with underweight bread rate being high. This show noncompliance with set standard packed bread weights.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
·          Both market and production damages were analyzed from 17/05/2025 - 13/06/2025.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
·          The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.

·          Control of production and market damages is commendable.
attributes.effect: Having bread damages within the tolerable limits implies that the company is not exposed to losses and revenue targets were realized.

value: Strict adherence to the production process will be implemented to ensure that bread damages are minimized to very low levels.
We will continue to maintain bread damages at minimal levels.
May 2025 audit report highlighted high production damages rate (at 0.24% of total loaves produced) as analyzed from 15.04.25 – 15.05.25.
Previous

·          The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

·          Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ Bread damages were within the tolerable range hence compliant with set policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring bread damages are minimized.

attributes.title: Broken bread damages (sent to ingredients)-Analysis
attributes.description:
·           As per the records, there was 1,157.8 kg of bread damages that was to be sent to ingredients department.

·           A total of 948.6kg was sent over the same period hence the expected physical balance was 209.2kg.

·           On the spot-check day 199.25kg of bread damages was found giving a variance of -9.95kg (-25loaves).

 Below is a summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·           The branch management should ensure that all bread damages are properly accounted for as observed.
attributes.effect: Minimal variance noted implies there was accountability of bread damages.

value: We will always ensure control of bread damages.
Broken bread damages sent to ingredient department will always be properly managed.
May 2025 audit report highlighted that bread damages were properly accounted for as analyzed from 15/04/25 – 15/05/25.
Previous
·           Bread damages recorded from 01/06/2025 – 16/06/2025 was compared with the damages sent and the physical damages in the branch to identify if the branch accounted for all bread damages.
+ Broken bread damages destined for ingredients department were properly accounted for.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring broken down bread damages meant for ingredients department is accounted for.

attributes.title: Mixing charts/summaries analysis
attributes.description:
Below are the summary of the findings

16.05.25 – 15.06.25:

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·          Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect: + Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
We will strengthen document accuracy to ensure that accurate information is conveyed on registers and SAP system.
May 2025 audit report highlighted that actual raw material consumption quantities as per manual mixing charts matched that of SAP system as analyzed from 15.04.25 – 15.05.25.
Previous
·          Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 16.05.25 – 15.06.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Production data was accurate and was as well accurately transferred from mixing charts to the SAP system.
Operations/Production Department

+ Ensuring raw material standard consumption recipes are adhered to.

+ Ensuring that mixing charts production records match those of mixing chart summary and SAP system.

attributes.title: Physical cash verification
attributes.description:
·           Physical cash was verified on 16/06/2025, and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

·           Minimal variances were noted during spot-check.
attributes.recommendation: ·          Observed cash control is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Minimal cash variance suggests minimal cash loss risk and effective controls were put in place.

value: Proper cash control will be maintained.
This trend will be maintained.
Physical cash verification on 16.05.25 showed minimal cash verification.
Previous
·           A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the company petty cash was well maintained.

+ Cash controls were effective.

+ Cash loss risk was minimal.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring proper cash controls. Ensuring cash is properly accounted for.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check analysis.
attributes.description:
·          A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 16.06.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the noted good stock and cash control.
attributes.effect: Mini shop SOPs are adhered to.

value: We shall maintain control at the mini shop.
Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
+ Mini shop SOPs were adhered to as per spot check done on 16.05.2025.
Previous
·          A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Bread and crates at the mini shop were properly accounted for.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring bread and crates transferred to the mini shop is accounted for.

attributes.title: Bread yield analysis
attributes.description:
·          From 16/05/2024 – 15/06/2025, aggregate yield (after conversion to 400g) ranged from 189.47 – 190.47lvs/bag, with an average of 190.1lvs/bag.

·          From 3,719bags, total yield expected was 706,983.25pcs (upon conversion to 400g) and 706,983.25pcs was reflected on production records. Thus, expected yields were realized.

·          Breakdown of yields for the various bread varieties is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·         Noted realization of yield targets is commendable.
attributes.effect: Revenue targets were realized.

value: We will ensure set yields are always produced and recorded.
We will maintain this trend by ensuring set standard yields are always adhered to.
+ May 2025 audit report highlighted that set yield standards were realized as analyzed from 15.04.25 – 15.05.2025.
Previous

·          The exercise was conducted to determine if resulting yields for each variety matched expected yields (as per set BOMs) and also establish the consistency. Low yields than expected would be translated as concealing of actual yields denying the company revenues.
+ Set standard bread yields were realized hence compliance to set policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set standard bread yields (BOM) are achieved.

attributes.title: Outstanding customer debts analysis.
attributes.description: ·         Outstanding debts for customers was Kshs. 135,931.50 (with security worth 559,279.30) while that of institutions was Kshs. 1,699,054.00.
attributes.recommendation: ·         Sales crew and the sales representative to ensure that bread supplied is paid for on delivery for customers without credit arrangement.
attributes.effect: High unsecured outstanding debts without security exposes the company to a great risk of bad debts.

value:
Sales Representative.

·         All customer debts are secured.

·         Institution debts are managed from the head office.

Sales Representative.

·         All customer debts are secured.

·         Institution debts are managed from the head office.
May 2025 audit report highlighted institution outstanding debt amounting to Kshs. 1,807,906.00.
Previous
+ Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 17th June 2025 for routes was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ Outstanding customer debts especially for institutions were noted which had no security. This contravenes set policy.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring no customer outstanding balance for bread sales made.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis
attributes.description:
PRODUCTION EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Analysis was done from 16/05/2025 - 15/06/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·          Branch management should ensure proper planning is put in place to ensure set standard production efficiency is observed is maintained.
attributes.effect: + Adhering to set production efficiency standards checked production costs.

value: + We will maintain and even improve on the observed production efficiency to ensure set standards are achieved , maintained and improved.
+ Noted trend will be maintained.
+ May 2025 audit report highlighted  production inefficiency i.e. 4.46bags/staff as analyzed from 15.04.25 – 15.05.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.
+ Set standard production efficiency was adhered to rather achieved hence compliance with set policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set production efficiency standards are achieved.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description: ·          Packing efficiency (16/05/2025 – 15/06/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          Branch management should ensure proper planning is put in place to ensure set standard packing efficiency is achieved.

·          Surplus payments due to packing inefficiency should be surcharged.
attributes.effect: + Packing inefficiency increased production costs.

value:
·          We will put in necessary measures to address packing inefficiency.

Bakery workers in slicing section to be strictly supervised for an improved efficiency going forward.
Noted Packing inefficiency will be addressed.
May 2025 audit report highlighted packing inefficiency i.e. 95.6crates/packer as analyzed from 15.04.25 – 15.05.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·         Packing efficiency standard was set at 1455pcs/person/8hr shift.
+ Packing inefficiency was noted hence noncompliance with set efficiency standards.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set packing efficiency standard of 97crates/packer/8hr is achieved.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption standard rate analysis
attributes.description: ·           Motor vehicle fuel consumption standards is as follows;
attributes.recommendation: + Having set fuel standard consumption rate for each vehicle is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Set fuel consumption rates enables determining or monitoring fuel consumption for motor vehicles.

value: + Standard fuel consumption rates for motor vehicles were provided.
+ Standard fuel consumption rates for motor vehicles were provided by KAF and are reviewed over a period of time.
+ May 2025 report showed that fuel standard consumption rates for each vehicle was provided.
Previous

+ This test was conducted to ascertain whether sales vans have set fuel consumption rate. The rates are important in determining fuel quantities to be filled on vans after route sales depending on distance covered.
+ Motor vehicles had set standard fuel consumption rate in compliance to set policies.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring that all sales vans have set fuel consumption standard rate each.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle mileage and fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description: Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/05/2025 – 31/05/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table
attributes.recommendation: ·          Noted economical fuel consumption for most sales vans is commendable.
attributes.effect: Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs.

value: Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
Constant monitoring of sales vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
+ May 2025 audit report noted economical fuel consumption by sales vans during April 2025.
Previous

·           The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans and generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Motor vehicle fuel consumption was economical and in line with set fuel consumption policies.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring that fuel consumption by sales vans is as per set policies.

attributes.title: Generator fuel filling analysis.
attributes.description: + Generator register and Telematic system were compared for fuel quantity filled during the period ranging 31/01/25 - 18/06/2025.
attributes.recommendation:
+  After filling fuel into the generators, person managing the telematic system should flag any variation noted real time in order to check noted variations.

+ Variation in fuel filling quantities between generator register and tracking system should be explained.
attributes.effect: + Generator fuel was not accounted for.

value: + All fuel purchased is filled into the generator.

+ We will contact the person manning the Telematic system to check if the tracker has an issue because we always ensure no fuel balance is left and all purchased quantity is filled into the generator.
This test was not done during the previous audit visit.
Current

+ Generator register fuel filled was compared to fillings on the Telematic system to check if there were variations.

+ Variations were flagged.

+ Variations were noted between fuel filling quantities on the generator book and those of Telematic system.

+ Generator fuel (211.7ltrs) could not be accounted for.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring fuel filling quantities on generator register match those of Telematic system.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
Generator fuel consumption.

·           Generator fuel consumption from 01/06/2025 – 18/06/2025.

·           Below is a tabular illustration of generator consumption.

GENERATOR : (01/06/25 - 18/06/25)
attributes.recommendation: + The branch management should liaise with KAF to have set fuel consumption rate for the generators. This will enable monitoring over or underconsumption of generator fuel.
attributes.effect: + Generator fuel consumption cannot be properly determined or accounted for since generators have no set fuel consumption rates.

value: + We are directed to enquire the fuel due to be filled on the generators from the Tracking office, upon which we purchase the authorized quantity and filled it into the generator.
+ We will contact the KAF department to have the generators fuel consumption rate set.
+ This test was not done during the previous adudit.
Current

·           The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.

+ Generators have no set fuel consumption rate which is against set policies.

+ Fuel consumption by the generators cannot be monitored or properly accounted for.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring generators have set standard fuel consumption rate in order to monitor fuel consumption and ensure full accountability of fuel purchased for the generators.
